items.name: IORETENR
items.description: port Standby IO retention enable register

items.name: IORETRA
items.description: port Standby IO retention status register

items.name: RADIOSCR
items.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO status and control register

fields.name: LPMS
fields.description: Low-power mode selection These bits select the low-power mode entered when the CPU enters the SleepDeep mode. 10x: Standby mode others reserved

fields.name: R2RSB1
fields.description: SRAM2 retention in Standby mode This bit is used to keep the SRAM2 content in Standby retention mode.

fields.name: ULPMEN
fields.description: BOR0 ultra-low-power mode.  This bit is used to reduce the consumption by configuring the BOR0 in discontinuous mode for Stop 1 and Standby modes. Discontinuous mode is only available when BOR levels 1 to 4 and PVD are disabled. Note: This bit must be set to reach the lowest power consumption in the low-power modes. Note: This bit must not be set together with autonomous peripherals using HSI as kernel clock. Note: When BOR level 1 to 4 or PVD is enabled continuous mode applies independent from ULPMEN.

fields.name: RADIORSB
fields.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO SRAMs (RXTXRAM and Sequence RAM) and Sleep clock retention in Standby mode. This bit is used to keep the 2.4 GHz RADIO SRAMs content in Standby retention mode and the 2.4 GHz RADIO sleep timer counter operational.

fields.name: R1RSB1
fields.description: SRAM1 retention in Standby mode This bit is used to keep the SRAM1 content in Standby retention mode.

fields.name: SRAM1PDS1
fields.description: SRAM1 power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1) Note: The SRAM1 retention in Standby mode is controlled by R1RSB1 bit in CR1.

fields.name: SRAM2PDS1
fields.description: SRAM2 power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1) Note: The SRAM2 retention in Standby mode is controlled by R2RSB1 bit in CR1.

fields.name: ICRAMPDS
fields.description: ICACHE SRAM power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1)

fields.name: FLASHFWU
fields.description: Flash memory fast wakeup from Stop modes (Stop 0, 1) This bit is used to obtain the best trade-off between low-power consumption and wakeup time when exiting the Stop 0 or Stop 1 modes. When this bit is set, the Flash memory remains in normal mode in Stop 0 and Stop 1 modes, which offers a faster startup time with higher consumption.

fields.name: FSTEN
fields.description: Fast soft start

fields.name: DBP
fields.description: Disable Backup domain write protection In reset state, all registers and SRAM in Backup domain are protected against parasitic write access. This bit must be set to enable the write access to these registers.

fieldset/IORETENR.description: port A Standby IO retention enable register

fields.name: EN
fields.description: Port A Standby GPIO retention enable Access can be protected by GPIOA SECy, privilege protection is controlled by SPRIV or NSPRIV. When set, each bit enables the Standby GPIO retention feature for PAy

fieldset/IORETR.description: port A Standby IO retention status register

fields.name: RET
fields.description: Port A Standby GPIO retention active Access can be protected by GPIOA SECy, privilege protection is controlled by SPRIV or NSPRIV.

fields.name: SPRIV
fields.description: secure functions privilege configuration This bit is set and reset by software. It can be written only by a secure privileged access.

fields.name: NSPRIV
fields.description: non-secure functions privilege configuration This bit is set and reset by software. It can be written only by privileged access, secure or non-secure.

fieldset/RADIOSCR.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO status and control register

fields.name: MODE
fields.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO operating mode. 1x: 2.4 GHz RADIO active mode

fields.name: PHYMODE
fields.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO PHY operating mode

fields.name: ENCMODE
fields.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO encryption function operating mode

fields.name: RFVDDHPA
fields.description: 2.4 GHz RADIO VDDHPA control word. Bits [3:0] see Table 81: PA output power table format for definition. Bit [4] rf_event.

fields.name: REGPARDYVDDRFPA
fields.description: Ready bit for V<sub>DDHPA</sub> voltage level when selecting VDDRFPA input. Note: REGPARDYVDDRFPA does not allow to detect correct V<sub>DDHPA</sub> voltage level when request to lower the level.

fields.name: WUP1SEC
fields.description: WUP1 secure protection

fields.name: LPMSEC
fields.description: Low-power modes secure protection

fields.name: VDMSEC
fields.description: Voltage detection secure protection

fields.name: VBSEC
fields.description: Backup domain secure protection

fields.name: CSSF
fields.description: Clear Stop and Standby flags Access can be secured by LPMSEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV. Writing 1 to this bit clears the STOPF and SBF flags.

fields.name: STOPF
fields.description: Stop flag This bit is set by hardware when the device enters a Stop or Standby mode at the same time as the sysclk has been set by hardware to select HSI. It’s cleared by software by writing 1 to the CSSF bit and by hardware when SBF is set.

fields.name: SBF
fields.description: Standby flag This bit is set by hardware when the device enters the Standby mode and the CPU restart from its reset vector. It’s cleared by writing 1 to the CSSF bit, or by a power-on reset. It is not cleared by the system reset.

fields.name: PVDE
fields.description: Programmable voltage detector enable

fields.name: PVDLS
fields.description: Programmable voltage detector level selection These bits select the voltage threshold detected by the programmable voltage detector:

fields.name: PVDO
fields.description: Programmable voltage detector output

fields.name: ACTVOSRDY
fields.description: Voltage level ready for currently used VOS

fields.name: ACTVOS
fields.description: VOS currently applied to V<sub>CORE</sub> This field provides the last VOS value.

fields.name: VOSRDY
fields.description: Ready bit for V<sub>CORE</sub> voltage scaling output selection Set and cleared by hardware. When decreasing the voltage scaling range, VOSRDY must be one before increasing the SYSCLK frequency.

fields.name: VOS
fields.description: Voltage scaling range selection Set a and cleared by software. Cleared by hardware when entering Stop 1 mode. Access can be secured by RCC SYSCLKSEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: WUPEN
fields.description: Wakeup and interrupt pin WKUP1 enable Access can be secured by WUP1SEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: WUPP
fields.description: Wakeup pin WKUP1 polarity. This bit must be configured when WUPEN1 = 0. Access can be secured by WUP1SEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: WUSEL1
fields.description: Wakeup and interrupt pin WKUP1 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN1 = 0. Access can be secured by WUP1SEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: WUSEL2
fields.description: Wakeup and interrupt pin WKUP2 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN2 = 0. Access can be secured by WUP2SEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: WUSEL3
fields.description: Wakeup and interrupt pin WKUP3 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN3 = 0. Access can be secured by WUP3SEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: WUSEL4
fields.description: Wakeup and interrupt pin WKUP4 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN4 = 0. Access can be secured by WUP4SEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: WUSEL5
fields.description: Wakeup and interrupt pin WKUP5 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN5 = 0. Access can be secured by WUP5SEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: WUSEL6
fields.description: Wakeup and interrupt pin WKUP6 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN6 = 0. Access can be secured by WUP6SEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: WUSEL7
fields.description: Wakeup and interrupt pin WKUP7 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN7 = 0. Access can be secured by WUP7SEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: WUSEL8
fields.description: Wakeup and interrupt pin WKUP8 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN8 = 0. Access can be secured by WUP8SEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV.

fields.name: CWUF
fields.description: Clear wakeup flag 1 Access can be secured by WUP1SEC. When secure, a non-secure read/write access is RAZ/WI. It does not generate an illegal access interrupt. This bit can be protected against unprivileged access when secure with SPRIV or when non-secure with NSPRIV. Writing 1 to this bit clears the WUF1 flag in WUSR.

fields.name: WUF
fields.description: Wakeup and interrupt pending flag 1 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on WKUP1 pin. This bit is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF1 bit of WUSCR or by hardware when WUPEN1 = 0.

variants.name: LowPower
variants.description: Flash memory enters low-power mode in Stop 0 and Stop 1 modes (lower-power consumption).

variants.name: Normal
variants.description: Flash memory remains in normal mode in Stop 0 and Stop 1 modes (faster wakeup time).

variants.name: Retained
variants.description: ICACHE SRAM content retained in Stop modes

variants.name: NotRetained
variants.description: ICACHE SRAM content lost in Stop modes

variants.name: pvd_in
variants.description: External input analog voltage PVD_IN (compared internally to VREFINT)

variants.name: AboveOrEqual
variants.description: VDD is equal or above the PVD threshold selected by PVDLS[2:0].

variants.name: Below
variants.description: VDD is below the PVD threshold selected by PVDLS[2:0].

variants.name: PoweredOn
variants.description: SRAM1 content retained in Stop modes

variants.name: PoweredOff
variants.description: SRAM1 content lost in Stop modes
